conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true cutaway 3D model: walls extruded with thickness, multiple wall faces visible, elevated/isometric-like camera, and ceiling removed to expose interior volume.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Clear wall height/thickness and readable room volumes; clean cutaway with mostly consistent 3D corner geometry. Minor simplification/softness in some junctions but still structurally coherent.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Room set and adjacency largely match (bedroom top-left, toilet top-center/right, utility top-right, kitchen right, living/dining center-left, balcony bottom-left, entry/foyer bottom). Some proportional/partition placement differences are noticeable (kitchen/foyer boundary and a few wall lengths/openings not perfectly matching the 2D plan).

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture and fixtures present: bed, sofa, dining table, kitchen counters/appliances, bathroom fixtures, utility element. Placement is mostly room-correct with reasonable scale; a few items are simplified blocks.

visual_clarity.notes: Geometry is readable with distinct walls/floors and adequate lighting. Materials are uniform/neutral (acceptable but reduces clarity of openings). Text label inside the 3D scene reduces presentation cleanliness.

detected_errors.description: Minor layout/proportion drift: some wall lengths and the kitchen/foyer partitioning do not perfectly match the 2D plan proportions.
Some door/window opening placements and sizes appear approximate rather than precisely matching the 2D plan.
Text label ('BALC 4'WIDE') is present within the 3D render, reducing presentation cleanliness.
Very uniform materials and minimal differentiation make openings and room boundaries slightly less distinct.

summary: A true cutaway 3D conversion with strong layout fidelity and interior elements, with only minor proportional/opening inaccuracies and minor presentation clutter from text.
